overview: CodeQL 2.24.1 adds Maven private package registry support (including plugin repositories), Kotlin 2.3.0 analysis support, C23/C++26 #embed directives, C# 14 null-conditional assignments, new Python taint models for AI-related modules, and multiple query accuracy improvements across languages.

detailed_explanation.title: Java/Kotlin language support
bullets: Kotlin versions up to 2.3.0 are now supported for analysis.
Struts 7.x package names are now recognized in the Struts framework library.
Maven private package registries configured for Default Setup now also serve as plugin repositories.
Support for Kotlin 1.6.x and 1.7.x series has been dropped (previously announced).

detailed_explanation.title: C/C++ language support
bullets: Added support for C23 and C++26 #embed preprocessor directives.

detailed_explanation.title: C# language support
bullets: C# 14: support for null-conditional assignments added.

detailed_explanation.title: Python language support
bullets: List elements can now be referenced in the Python models-as-data language via the ListElement path.
Taint flow and type models added for the agents and openai modules.
Remote flow sources modeled for the websockets package.

detailed_explanation.title: Query accuracy improvements
bullets: C/C++: Fixed a bug in GuardCondition library where binary logical operators were not recognized as guard conditions.

C/C++: Improved buffer size measurement accuracy, reducing false positives in six overflow-related queries (cpp/static-buffer-overflow, cpp/overflow-buffer, cpp/badly-bounded-write, cpp/overrunning-write, cpp/overrunning-write-with-float, cpp/very-likely-overrunning-write).
Java: Improved accuracy of the java/unreleased-lock query.
Python: New experimental query py/prompt-injection for detecting prompt injection vulnerabilities in LLM-using code.
GitHub Actions: Fixed a crash when analyzing ${{ ... }} expressions over ~300 characters.

detailed_explanation.title: Deployment and availability
bullets: CodeQL 2.24.1 is automatically deployed to GitHub code scanning users on github.com.
The new functionality will be included in a future GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) release.
Older GHES versions can manually upgrade their CodeQL version.

key_changes: Maven private registries now double as plugin repositories when configured for Default Setup.
Kotlin analysis support extended to 2.3.0; Kotlin 1.6.x/1.7.x dropped.
Python taint models added for openai and agents modules; remote flow sources for websockets.
New experimental py/prompt-injection query for detecting LLM prompt injection vulnerabilities.
Six C/C++ buffer overflow queries produce fewer false positives.
GitHub Actions analysis crash on long expressions fixed.
impact: Java teams using Maven private registries with Default Setup gain automatic plugin repository configuration.
Kotlin teams must be on 1.8.x or later as 1.6.x/1.7.x support is removed.
C/C++ codebases will see fewer false positive alerts for buffer overflow queries.
Python developers using OpenAI/agents libraries benefit from improved taint tracking for security analysis.
Teams building LLM-powered applications can detect prompt injection risks with the new experimental query.
GHES users need to manually upgrade CodeQL or wait for the next GHES release to get these improvements.
caveats: The py/prompt-injection query is experimental and may produce false positives or miss some patterns.
Kotlin 1.6.x and 1.7.x are no longer supported â€” projects using these versions must upgrade.
GHES users do not receive the update automatically and must either wait for a GHES release or manually upgrade.
The exact GHES release version that will include CodeQL 2.24.1 is not stated in the article.
insights: The addition of taint models for openai and agents modules reflects the growing importance of AI/LLM security in code scanning.
The experimental py/prompt-injection query positions CodeQL as a tool for securing AI-powered applications.
Maven plugin repository support for private registries addresses a common pain point in enterprise Java environments.
The continued expansion of language version support (Kotlin 2.3.0, C# 14, C23/C++26) keeps CodeQL aligned with modern language evolution.
